document_title: Atrial tachycardia: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis, prevention
subsection_content: Sustained atrial tachycardia can lead to cardiomyopathy (weakening of the heart muscle) and heart failure. This cardiomyopathy is usually reversible if the disease is controlled. Sometimes atrial tachycardia can lead to another, more serious type of arrhythmia, atrial fibrillation.
subsection_title: nhip nhanh nhi.json. Complications of atrial tachycardia

nhip nhanh nhi.json. Complications of atrial tachycardia
Sustained atrial tachycardia can lead to cardiomyopathy (weakening of the heart muscle) and heart failure. This cardiomyopathy is usually reversible if the disease is controlled. Sometimes atrial tachycardia can lead to another, more serious type of arrhythmia, atrial fibrillation.
